name: Hotel Relais Modica

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Relais for 3 nights. We loved Modica and the Hotel Relais. We had a very large room and it was very private. We were close to the terrace which has magnificent views of Modica. We ran into some car trouble and the hotel owner was invaluable to us - so helpful. The staff was friendly and so welcoming. Be aware there are a number of stairs to climb but it is well worth it. Modica is a wonderful place to stay and explore Ragusa, Nota, Modica, and the marina areas. I would recommed Modica and the surrounding area as a must see for any travellers to Sicily. Must try the Modica chocolate.
reviews.title: Wonderful people

reviews.text: The Hotel Relais is the kind of small B&B one can find in Europe but almost never in the U.S.: centrally located, intimate, historic, and personal, plus affordable. The warm-hearted and kindly proprietor, Antonio, makes you feel as if you are a guest in his private home. He and his wife are always ready to assist, yet they are never intrusive. (And he makes a wonderful caffe latte.)
reviews.title: That personal touch
A Room With a View
reviews.text: Our room, number 9, had an awesome view over this striking "vertical" town, and the roof terrace was a sublime place to sip some wine and admire the dramatically illuminated, stepped facades after sunset. The room was the darkest and quietest of all our Sicilian lodgings, and we slept very well.

Staying in Hotel Relais allowed us to sit on the balcony and gaze at the stunningly beautiful panorama of Modica stretched out before us, with San Giorgio taking centre stage. Modica is a beautiful, real living town with fabulous architecture - it's a warm, sensuous, exciting place. The hotel is charming and Antonio & his wife are wonderful hosts; if Lorenzo is at reception, he will help you with everything and anything. It was an unforgettable stay & it was extremely difficult to leave.
reviews.title: A miraculous view from a beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I arrived in Modica where the street names are hard to find but the Hotel Relais was not with many signs pointing the way. Antonio, the owner, from the moment we arrived was great. He gave us great advice on where to go, things to see and where to eat. He makes you feel like your apart of his family and goes to great lengths to make sure you're taken care of while at his hotel. He speaks 6 languages which was extremely impressive. There are a lot of stairs to reach the hotel but well worth the trek. If you spend a little time talking with Antonio, he may even have a beer with you as he tells you the history and splendor of his town. Great guy and a great place to stay.
reviews.title: The Chocolate, Wine, and Owner are Fantatic
Full of character
reviews.text: We found the Relais Modica charming and full of character. In late November we were the only guests and were offered a low season rate of 85 euros. We chose a triple room on the top floor - Room 10 - cozy and spacious with a slanting wood-beamed ceiling and great view, and steps away from a roof terrace overlooking the town. From our window we saw the town lit up at night and heard church bells in the early morning. Proprietor Antonio Modica was kind, helpful, engaging and stimulating to talk to, and was impassioned about almost everything -- culture, food, the state of Italy and the world. One of the many gracious citizens of Modica who made our stay here so rewarding.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room had an amazing view! This is the type of view that is worth the trip, waking up to it makes you forget the heat, the hours on the plane, anything! It is priceless.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but oh! the stairs!

reviews.text: The room in itself was fine and clean. The garden-roof top was a bit of a lie (where is the garden?) and the breakfast room had no window (a bit disappointing). The breakfast wasn't especially good, there was just bread and jams. It seemed poor compared to all the other breakfasts we had in Sicily.
reviews.title: Wonderful old world feel and service

likes.liked: — Friendly helpful owners, and the old-world feel of the rooms

description: Hotel Relais Modica is an Hotel "de charme" facing the Barocco in the town centre of Modica, from where You can easily reach on foot both the most beautiful monuments and the best restaurants and trattorias of the town. Our Hotel is an ancient noble palace completely restored 6 years ago, belonged to the Countess Mormino-Monelli and to the sicilian writer Vitaliano Brancati. You can see us on the web-siteWe just have 10 exclusive rooms all accessorizedwith private toilette-TV SAT-climatization- hair dryer- telephon, free internet point in the reception hallHotel Relais Modica is situated at 43 steps from the main road (Corso Umberto ).To reach the reception you can look for a parking along Corso Umberto , near the Theatre Garibaldi: there you’ll also see a small square where there is the Banca Intesa . At the corner of the bank you’ll see the stairs which brings up to the Hotel.
